    • Constructor Detail

      • Key

        protected Key()
        A Key in the DHT. Key's in the distributed hash table are just SHA-1 hashes. Key provides all necesarry operators to be used as a value.

      • Key

        Clone constructor

        Parameters:

      • threeWayDistance

        public int threeWayDistance(Key k1,
                            Key k2)
        Compares the distance of two keys relative to this one using the XOR metric
        Returns:
        -1 if k1 is closer to this key, 0 if k1 and k2 are equidistant, 1 if k2 is closer

      • findApproxKeyDistance

        public int findApproxKeyDistance(Key id)
        Returns the approximate distance of this key to the other key. Distance is simplified by returning the index of the first different Bit.
        Parameters:
        id - Key to compare to.
        Returns:
        integer marking the different bits of the keys

      • leadingOneBit

        public int leadingOneBit()

      • distance

        public Key distance(Key x)
        Calculates the distance between two Keys. The distance is basically a XOR of both key hashes.
        Parameters:
        x -
        Returns:
        new Key (this.hash ^ x.hash);

      • add

        public Key add(Key x)

      • naturalDistance

        public double naturalDistance(Key otherKey)
        calculates log2(this - otherKey % 2^161).
        To get the natural distance for ascending key order this should be the successive element of otherKey

      • distance

        public static Key distance(Key a,
                           Key b)
        Calculates the distance between two Keys. The distance is basically a XOR of both key hashes.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        new Key (a.hash ^ b.hash);
